text: rendering the md directly works fine. Hm. This struggle with md-files is the one thing I don't like with Franklin. There seems to be no way to work with them in Julia functions internally.

elements.text: rendering the md directly works fine. Hm. This struggle with md-files is the one thing I don't like with Franklin. There seems to be no way to work with them in Julia functions internally.

text: the included markdown rendered alone (disabled for that public version) works fine, including it into that page does not.

elements.text: the included markdown rendered alone (disabled for that public version) works fine, including it into that page does not.

text: I found a solution. Activate katex to also render things in `$...$` and use `md2html` , which even fits better since the md I want to parse really should be plain markdown without franklin-fancy-stuff.
